item.title: Data breach reveals Catwatchful ‘stalkerware’ is spying on thousands of phones
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The spyware operation's exposed customer email addresses and passwords were shared with data breach notification service Have I Been Pwned.

item.title: Hacked, leaked, exposed: Why you should never use stalkerware apps
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Using stalkerware is creepy, unethical, potentially illegal, and puts your data and that of your loved ones in danger.

item.title: Microsoft will lay off 9,000 employees, or less than 4% of the company
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Microsoft is leveraging another round of layoffs despite posting consistent growth.

item.title: Tesla faces second straight year of falling sales after another bad quarter
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Tesla sales fell more than 13% compared to last year as the company struggles to find demand for its aging lineup, and as CEO Elon Musk continues to damage the brand.

item.title: Rivian receives the next $1B from Volkswagen as sales struggles continue
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Rivian sales ticked back up in Q2 but were down 23% from the same quarter last year. The company has been dealing with affordability issues made worse by Trump's tariffs and trade wars.

item.title: Foxconn tells hundreds of Chinese staff to return from its Indian iPhone factories
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Foxconn ordered over 300 Chinese employees to return home from its factories in India, per Bloomberg.

item.title: Qantas hack results in theft of 6 million passengers’ personal data
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Qantas, the largest airline in Australia, confirmed the theft of 6 million customers' personal information.

item.title: Jon McNeill brings the operatorâ€™s playbook to TechCrunch All Stage
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: At TechCrunch All Stage 2025, Jon McNeill, CEO and co-founder of DVx Ventures, will take the Scale Stage to flip the script on conventional startup growth advice.

item.title: Congress just greenlit a NASA moon plan opposed by Musk and Isaacman
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: The $10 billion addition to the Artemis architecture, which includes funding for additional Space Launch System rockets and an orbiting station around the moon called Gateway, is a rebuke to critics who wished to see alternative technologies used instead.

item.title: ICEBlock, an app for anonymously reporting ICE sightings, goes viral overnight after Bondi criticism
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The citizen app for anonymously reporting ICE agents and raids went viral after criticism from the U.S. attorney general.

item.title: Figma moves closer to a blockbuster IPO that could raise $1.5B
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The financials are impressive and founder CEO Dylan Field already cashed out $20 million worth of shares last year.

item.title: Road to Battlefield: Central Eurasia’s gateway to TechCrunch Startup Battlefield
item.dc:creator: Cindy Zackney
item.description: Historic regional competition launches to showcase Central Eurasia’s rising startup ecosystem on Silicon Valley’s biggest stage. For the first time in its history, Central Eurasia will have a direct pathway to TechCrunch Startup Battlefield through the launch of “Road to Battlefield,” a groundbreaking regional competition that promises to put the underrepresented region firmly on the […]

item.title: X is piloting a program that lets AI chatbots generate Community Notes
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The social platform X will pilot a feature that allows AI chatbots to generate Community Notes, a Twitter-era feature that Elon Musk has expanded under his ownership of the service now called X.

item.title: Catalio Capital closes over $400M Fund IV
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Catalio Capital Management announced the closing of its more than $400 million Fund IV. The fund will continue the firmâ€™s thesis of backing healthcare and biotechnology companies.Â

item.title: Googleâ€™s data center energy use doubled in 4 years
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Google has pledged to use only carbon-free sources of electricity to power its operations, a task made more challenging by its breakneck pace of data center growth.

item.title: Automattic puts Tumblr migration to WordPress on hold
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Automattic CEO Matt Mullenweg confirmed that the company is no longer working on migrating its Tumblr blogging platform to WordPress, as previously announced.

item.title: Winning capital for your AI startup? Kleida Martiro is leading the conversation at TechCrunch All Stage
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: AI-native startups are rewriting the rules of what early traction looks like â€” and too often, investors are still playing by the old ones. At TechCrunch All Stage, happening in Boston on July 15, Kleida Martiro, partner at Glasswing Ventures, will lead a breakout that cuts straight to the core of this disconnect.

item.title: Nothing releases its first over-the-ear headphones, the $299 Headphone (1)
item.dc:creator: Maggie Stamets
item.description: Nothing stepped away from sensors in favor of a simple button to trigger your AI assistant or ChatGPT, if you have the Nothing X app, and a volume roller that can also be pressed to play, pause, and turn on and off noise canceling.

item.title: The electric Hummer is almost outselling the F-150 Lightning
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: GM's EVs were popular in the second quarter, a complete contrast to the struggles by Ford, Tesla, Hyundai, and Kia to grow electric vehicle sales.

item.title: Nothing releases its first over-the-ear headphones
item.dc:creator: TC Video
item.description: Nothing has revealed its first over-the-ear headphones. The aluminum and transparent Headphone (1) was designed in collaboration with KEF. They offer adaptive noise canceling, bass enhancement for deeper low frequencies, and spatial audio, for $299 at launch. But spoiler alert: The buttons on these headphones might be the best part.
